= File-sharing downloader/uploader =

Plowshare is a command-line downloader and uploader for some of the most popular file sharing websites. It works on UNIX-like systems and currently supports Megaupload, Rapidshare, 2Shared, 4Shared, ZShare, Badongo and Mediafire:

http://code.google.com/p/plowshare/

= Hotkeys for the X-Window =

Xhotkeys provides a simple and easily configurable hotkey launcher for the X-Window System, binding keys and mouse buttons to configurable commands. It should work on all desktops (Gnome, KDE, ...) available for the GNU/Linux operating system. Configuration files can be modified manually or using a graphical GTK+ configurator.

http://xhotkeys.googlecode.com

= Asterisk Phonepatch =

The term _phonepatch_ usually refers to the hardware device used to connect a radio transceiver and a phoneline. Asterisk-phonepatch do that task, but it's mainly software, as it uses the Asterisk software PBX.

http://www.nongnu.org/asterisk-phpatch

= Pyeuler Project =

The [http://www.projecteuler.org Euler Project] proposes some mathematical problems to be solved using any programming language. In this wiki, we see and discuss solutions using Python and functional programming. Python is not a functional-language, but it was interesting anyhow:

http://pyeuler.wikidot.com

= Guess user and password for DSL routers =

Sometimes I am helping a friend with the DSL connection and I need to access the HTTP router management utility (which was forgotten, lost or never known). Therefore I created this utility that tries the more commonly used user/password pairs.

http://tokland.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/dpl/dpl.py

You will also need the [http://tokland.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/dpl/dpl.txt TXT passwords list] and, optionally, the [http://tokland.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/dpl/dpl.html source HTML passwords] ([http://www.phenoelit-us.org/dpl/dpl.html latest version])

= Simple math game solver =

Given a bunch of numbers, and using the basic operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide) find -or be as close as possible to- another given number. Spanish readers will recall it from the popular *Cifras y Letras* TV quiz show.

http://tokland.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/cifras/cifras.py

{{{
$ python cifras.py 3 7 10 50 100 8 546 
546 = ((((50+7)*8)-10)+100)
}}}
